intro: Homalobus filipes, commonly known as the slender-leafed homalobus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
